title: 114_hr4394
content: The Act is titled the "Opportunities in Cooperative Education And New Research Partnerships Act" or the "OCEAN Research Partnerships Act." It includes references to the National Sea Grant College Program Act and repeals a coordination requirement in the National Sea Grant College Program Amendments of 2002. SEC. 4 amends the National Sea Grant College Program objectives and funding allocation. SEC. 5 establishes the Dean John A. Knauss Marine Policy Fellowships. Amendments to Section 208(b) (16 U.S.C. 1127(b)) prioritize placement of fellows in the legislative branch based on jurisdiction over NOAA or interest in ocean resources. During fiscal year 2016 and beyond, Federal agencies can appoint qualified candidates directly to positions without following certain provisions of title 5, United States Code. Qualified candidates include former Dean John A. Knauss Marine Policy Fellows. During fiscal year 2016 and beyond, Federal agencies can appoint qualified candidates directly to positions without following certain provisions of title 5, United States Code. Qualified candidates include former recipients of a fellowship related to ocean, coastal, or Great Lakes science, resource management, law, or policy from an accredited institution of higher education who have earned a graduate or postgraduate degree in a related field and successfully fulfilled the fellowship requirements. The head of a Federal agency may not exercise direct appointment authority with respect to a specific qualified candidate after the end of a 3-year period. The amendment made by subsection (a)(2) of this section shall apply beginning with respect to the first calendar year after the date of enactment of this Act. SEC. 6. NATIONAL SEA GRANT ADVISORY BOARD REPORTS amended to require periodic reports to Congress every 3 years. SEC. 7. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Section 212 (33 U.S.C. 1131) is amended to authorize appropriations to the Secretary for fiscal years 2016 to 2021, with increasing amounts allocated each year. Additionally, $18,000,000 is authorized for competitive grants for university research on biology for each fiscal year from 2016 to 2021. University research on aquatic nonnative species, oyster diseases, harmful algal blooms, coastal resilience, sustainable aquaculture, and fishery extension activities. Fishery extension activities conducted by sea grant colleges or institutes to enhance existing core program funding, with limitations on administration expenses not exceeding 5.5 percent of authorized or appropriated amounts. The Director has authority to meet critical staffing requirements under specific codes and sections, with costs incurred not counted towards program administration expenses. Subsection (c) is removed and subsections (d) and (e) are redesignated. In subsection (c), the Director has authority to meet critical staffing requirements under specific codes and sections, with costs not counted towards program administration expenses. Subsections (d) and (e) are redesignated as subsections (c) and (d) respectively. Subsection (d) is amended to include an exception for prize competitions. SEC. 8. TECHNICAL CORRECTIONS. The National Sea Grant College Program Act is amended to make technical corrections in sections 202(a)(6) and 204(d)(3)(B).
